title: As a user I want to be able to create a Major/Minor Outright transaction for a player who is currently on Option
custom_steps:
MJ/MN Outright Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89349694


Acceptance Criteria: 
* The rule check on a MJ/MN Outright that prevents the transaction being done for MN league players needs to be updated to recognize that players on Option ARE MJ league players. This will allow the MJ/MN Outright to be initiated for Optioned players. 
* The rule check on a MJ/MN Outright  (Rule 6.02) that prevents the transaction being submitted for players with a MJ roster status of "Optioned" will likewise need to be updated to allow for this move.

title: As a user I want to see a "Recalled for Subsequent Assignment" checkbox on Recall transactions
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=recall

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing new and historical Recall transactions, the BOC should always see the checkbox "Recalled for Subsequent Assignment". 
* The historical information from ebis1 will need to somehow be ETLed into ebis2 so that this information is not lost. 
* The checkbox should only be visible to Clubs if the checkbox is checked. 
* The checkbox will only be editable by the BOC. 
* Checking the "Recalled for Subsequent Assignment" checkbox should bypass the rule check associated with the "Player to Replace" field.

title: As a user I want approving a Major/Minor Outright transaction for a player who is currently on Option to auto-recall them
custom_steps:
MJ/MN Outright Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89349694

Recall Business Rules: 


Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a MJ/MN Outright is approved for a player that is currently Optioned, the system should auto-create and approve a Recall transaction for the player prior to outrighting him. 
* The Recall should be created for the same transaction date for the Outright. 
* The Recall should have the "Recalled for Subsequent Assignment" checkbox checked. 
* The Recall should have the Report Date field empty. 
* The Recall should be processed as normal by the system, and inserted in the player's history prior to the MJ/MN Outright. 
* If for any reason the on submit/on approve rules for the Recall fail for the player, the MJ/MN Outright should also fail and not be approved. The error message for the recall should display for the user.

* "Print Letter" is a button on the CEP tab of the Professional Player Profile. 
* Clicking "Print Letter" will launch a popover with a selection of available player letters to create. 
* "Needs More Info" will be one of the options. 
* Selecting Needs More Info will launch a pop-up where the user can enter information to be pre-populated in the form. 
* The pop-up should match the provided wireframe. 
* The Print button should be disabled until all required fields have been filled in
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the Needs More Info letter in the selected language according to the provided requirements.

title: As a user I want to print Multiple CEP Questionnaires
custom_steps:
Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+Welcome+Kit+-+Report+Layout

Report Details:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+Welcome+Kit+-+Report+Details

* When viewing the Current CSP/CEP widget, if the user has CSP Edit permissions, they see a "Print Questionnaires" button on the widget. 
* Clicking "Print Questionnaires" will launch a popover for the user to enter a Club Contact.
* Clicking "Print" from the popover will find all of the players on the selected Org that do not yet have a date populated for "Questionnaire Sent" and generate a single pdf containing the CSP or CEP Questionnaires for all of the players. 
* The Questionnaires printed for each player should match what would print for the player if the user selected "Print Questionnaire" from the player's profile and selected "Player" and their primary address.

title: As a user I want to see "Semester Max" on old CSP Invoices
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Rich would like us to update the "Tuition Allowance Max" and "Living Allowance Max" fields on CSP invoices for players who signed prior to 10/3/04 to say "Semester Max" or "Quarter Max" based on whether the invoice is for a Semester or a Quarter. 
* The calculations are the same, just the verbiage is changing.

title: As a user I want to be able to Save and Print from a CEP Invoice
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When in edit mode on a CEP Invoice, the user will see a "Save & Print" button, in addition to the regular Save and Print buttons. 
* Clicking "Save & Print" will allow the user to select which letter they want to print - just as if they had clicked "Print". 
* After they have chosen the options they want, clicking "Save & Print" will save any changes made to the invoice, display a blue successful save notification and generate a pdf of the selected letter in the chosen language.

title: As a user I want Max/Min and expandable filters to work together intuatively
custom_steps:
**AC**
*On Pending Approvals, Action Items and Advanced Search*

**Simple solution:**
- Clicking maximize will automatically collapse the filters
- Clicking minimize will simply minimize the widget, leaving the filters alone.

**More Difficult**
- If maximize is clicked and the filters are expanded check to see if the height of the widget will decrease.
      - If yes, it will decrease then collapse filters and maximize the widget
      - If no, it will not decrease then leave filters expanded and maximize the widget
- If minimize is clicked leave the filters as is and minimize the widget

**Original Problem:** Max/Min and expandable filters did not play well together.  On smaller screen sizes if man filters have been added to advanced search or on the clipboard hitting maximize will actually make the widget smaller and hitting minimize will make it larger.  This is because of how max/min determines how much screen real estate is available to use.

title: As a user I want to have a link to the new user/update access request form from the user accounts page
custom_steps: Wireframe: http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts Acceptance Criteria: * When viewing the User Accounts Listing tab, users see a link "Request new user or additional permissions" Embed link provided by Sean:

title: As a user I want to run the CEP Update batch
custom_steps:
Wires (generic): 
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=contrat_expiration
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=global_results_widget

Batch Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=91885937

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "CSP/CEP Update" appears as a batch option under the "Minor Contracts/CSP" section on the batch screen.
* Clicking "CSP/CEP Update" opens the batch in the batch screen. 
* The batch parameters display per the batch requirements. 
* A "Run" button is available. 
* Clicking "Run" will run the batch according to the selected parameters. 
* Running the batch will find all of the CSP's and CEP's that should be updated, and update the CSP or CEP information accordingly (see rules). 
* Any player who had their CSP or CEP information updated as a result of this batch running should display in the "Batch Results" widget. Available columns should be Player ID, Player's Name, Responsible Org, Current Org, Old Estimated Available Balance, New Estimated Available Balance, Old Balance, New Balance. 
* Batch run information should display in the batch history widget.
